Author: Alright#0419
Content: Don't understand why you don't use Emman's method to grab user/pass directly from the conf file

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I can't connect to remote server in this case and cant use custom directory

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Let's say I can run TUI on Raspberry and operate daemon on Ubuntu VPS

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: If parse config files - I think it's better to just use check_output stuff to call `komodo-cli` without RPC connection estabilishing

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Not totally understand why need to interact with daemon via RPC if you already know that you run software on the same machine with daemon and can just call it by OS methods (check_output for python) without password or path to password revealing.
If I work with RPC connection I want to abstract from OS on which daemon running, paths to software configs or anything else

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I just think 99% of people will be running any dapp on the same machine as the daemon, and the other 1% would be smart enough to change 2 lines in the code. My point is that I think you're catering to an edge case

Author: Alright#0419
Content: doesn't matter, was really just curious of your reasoning behind that

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I think optimal dAPP for non-technical people is when daemon not running on their machines at all (SPV stuff)

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Currents apps are for devs mostly obv

Content: I've thought about it, but we need some way to limit which commands will work

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Need to research how exactly that works. We need something like this for migrates.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Need a server that can handle the single KMD command needed, so users don't need a KMD node running to do a migrate

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Like a migrations serving node?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the `migrate_completeimporttransaction` step in a migrate requires a KMD full node

Author: Alright#0419
Content: but it isn't actually handling sensitive data

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so we should host a server that people can use specifically for that step
